meanings.definition: To surpass in state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The small town's dedication to community events outstates that of the neighboring city.
meanings.sent2: She always strives to outstate her previous achievements in academics.
meanings.sent3: The race between the tortoise and the hare ended with the tortoise outstating the hare in perseverance.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity outstate any material possessions she may have.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brightness outstates the dim glow of the moon.

meanings.definition: To remove from a state or condition.
meanings.sent1: The cleaning crew will outstate all the old furniture from the office.
meanings.sent2: He decided to outstate all negative thoughts from his mind and focus on the positive.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to outstate the coin from existence.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds threatened to outstate the leaves from the trees.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully outstated the bones from the fish fillet.

meanings.definition: Situated or originating outside a particular state.
meanings.sent1: The outstate visitors were amazed by the local cuisine.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to buy outstate products to support businesses from other regions.
meanings.sent3: The outstate guests brought a unique perspective to the discussion.
meanings.sent4: The outstate company had offices in multiple states.
meanings.sent5: The outstate students added diversity to the university campus.
